intro: Tambourissa parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved tambourissa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The flowers are often fragrant and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
